    Correlate Fire Weather Index and Burned Area

    correlate_bushfire.Rd

    Computes the correlation between Fire Weather Index (FWI) and burned area (in square kilometres) using the bushfire dataset. The correlation can be calculated either overall or separately for each year.

    correlate_bushfire(data, by_year = FALSE)

    Arguments

    data

    A data frame containing the variables year, fwi, and burned_area_km2, such as bushfire.

    by_year

    Logical; if TRUE, computes correlation separately for each year. Default is FALSE, which gives a single overall correlation value across all years.

    Value

    A tibble with either:

    metric

    A label for the correlation type ("overall" or "by year")

    year

    Year (if by_year = TRUE)

    correlation

    Pearson correlation coefficient between FWI and burned area

    Details

    This function helps assess how strongly fire weather intensity relates to actual burned area over time, supporting exploratory analysis or inclusion in the interactive Shiny app.

    Examples

    data(bushfire)

# Overall correlation
correlate_bushfire(bushfire)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   metric  correlation
#>   <chr>         <dbl>
#> 1 overall       0.382

# Correlation by year
correlate_bushfire(bushfire, by_year = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 22 × 2
#>     year correlation
#>    <dbl>       <dbl>
#>  1  1997       0.795
#>  2  1998       0.553
#>  3  1999       0.333
#>  4  2000       0.284
#>  5  2001       0.742
#>  6  2002       0.849
#>  7  2003       0.802
#>  8  2004      -0.380
#>  9  2005       0.360
#> 10  2006       0.241
#> # ℹ 12 more rows
